body:
Related code:

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/807f1cedaac3de6c527acbae2c7e4c40cab35fbd/backend/webdav/webdav.go#L449-L458



Referer is forced to set after setting custom headers?
@ncw - is this something to keep open / enhancement / close out?
It would be easy enough to not set the `Referer` if there was one set already - do you want to try adding that @nilaoda ?

> It would be easy enough to not set the `Referer` if there was one set already - do you want to try adding that @nilaoda ?

I want add specified referer to pass server referer policy

@nilaoda give this a go

[v1.59.0-beta.6085.82e24f521.fix-6040-webdav](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-6040-webdav/v1.59.0-beta.6085.82e24f521.fix-6040-webdav/) on branch [fix-6040-webdav](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-6040-webdav) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

It won't override Referer if you set it.


> And the Header's key is forced to be capitalized

That is go's HTTP library doing that. HTTP headers are case insensitive so it shouldn't matter.

> @nilaoda give this a go
> 
> [v1.59.0-beta.6085.82e24f521.fix-6040-webdav](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-6040-webdav/v1.59.0-beta.6085.82e24f521.fix-6040-webdav/) on branch [fix-6040-webdav](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-6040-webdav) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)
> 
> It won't override Referer if you set it.
> 
> > And the Header's key is forced to be capitalized
> 
> That is go's HTTP library doing that. HTTP headers are case insensitive so it shouldn't matter.

Thx! ^_^
@nilaoda did it work properly? If so I'll merge it - thanks!

@ncw Still confused,

###   `User-Agent` not working?

conf:
```config
headers = "Referer","https://www.aliyundrive.com/drive","User-Agent","Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Trident/7.0; rv:11.0) like Gecko"
```
log:
```
2022/04/26 17:50:35 DEBUG : PROPFIND /dav/2019.mkv HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.2.2:5244
User-Agent: rclone/v1.59.0-beta.6085.82e24f521.fix-6040-webdav
Authorization: XXXX
Depth: 1
Referer: https://www.aliyundrive.com/drive
Accept-Encoding: gzip
```

### Missing headers after Redirect ?
```
2022/04/26 17:50:35 DEBUG : GET /dav/2019.mkv HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.2.2:5244
User-Agent: rclone/v1.59.0-beta.6085.82e24f521.fix-6040-webdav
Authorization: XXXX
Depth: 0
Range: bytes=0-371982335
Referer: https://www.aliyundrive.com/drive


2022/04/26 17:50:35 DEBUG : >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
2022/04/26 17:50:36 DEBUG : <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<
2022/04/26 17:50:36 DEBUG : HTTP RESPONSE (req 0xc0008fda00)
2022/04/26 17:50:36 DEBUG : HTTP/1.1 302 Found
Content-Length: 566
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8
Date: Tue, 26 Apr 2022 09:50:36 GMT
Etag: "16e9663435815b802c574532"
Location: https://bj29.cn-beijing.data.alicloudccp.com/****


2022/04/26 17:50:36 DEBUG : <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<
2022/04/26 17:50:36 DEBUG : >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
2022/04/26 17:50:36 DEBUG : HTTP REQUEST (req 0xc0008fdc00)
2022/04/26 17:50:36 DEBUG : GET /**** HTTP/1.1
Host: bj29.cn-beijing.data.alicloudccp.com
User-Agent: rclone/v1.59.0-beta.6085.82e24f521.fix-6040-webdav
Depth: 0
Range: bytes=371982336-743916849
Referer: http://192.168.2.2:5244/dav/2019.mkv
```

Is it because two completely different host? Can it still add custom headers after the redirection? ðŸ˜”

> 2022/04/26 17:50:36 DEBUG : <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<
> 2022/04/26 17:50:36 DEBUG : >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
> 2022/04/26 17:50:36 DEBUG : HTTP REQUEST (req 0xc0008fdc00)
> 2022/04/26 17:50:36 DEBUG : GET /**** HTTP/1.1
> Host: bj29.cn-beijing.data.alicloudccp.com
> User-Agent: rclone/v1.59.0-beta.6085.82e24f521.fix-6040-webdav
> Depth: 0
> Range: bytes=371982336-743916849
> Referer: http://192.168.2.2:5244/dav/2019.mkv

I think that is the go standard library doing that - see https://github.com/golang/go/issues/44160 so I don't think I can work around that at the moment so easily.

I've merged the fix above to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) in 15-30 minutes and released in v1.59

> > 2022/04/26 17:50:36 DEBUG : <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<
> > 2022/04/26 17:50:36 DEBUG : >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
> > 2022/04/26 17:50:36 DEBUG : HTTP REQUEST (req 0xc0008fdc00)
> > 2022/04/26 17:50:36 DEBUG : GET /**** HTTP/1.1
> > Host: bj29.cn-beijing.data.alicloudccp.com
> > User-Agent: rclone/v1.59.0-beta.6085.82e24f521.fix-6040-webdav
> > Depth: 0
> > Range: bytes=371982336-743916849
> > Referer: http://192.168.2.2:5244/dav/2019.mkv
> 
> I think that is the go standard library doing that - see [golang/go#44160](https://github.com/golang/go/issues/44160) so I don't think I can work around that at the moment so easily.
> 
> I've merged the fix above to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) in 15-30 minutes and released in v1.59

Emm... Okay, I will wait for that. Maybe it is necessary to disable the automatic redirection and manual handle `302`, `301` response code.

Thanks for your help. ðŸ‘
